dialogueTree.title: Joyce Messier: ""This... *reality*?" She pulls her..."
dialogueTree.text: "This... *reality*?" She pulls her hood closer around her neck.

links.title: Drama: "Yes, reality is your side-case."
links.text: Yes, reality is your side-case.

links.title: Conceptualization: "An *experimental* side-case."
links.text: An *experimental* side-case.

links.title: Inland Empire: "The aim is to gain a deeper underst..."
links.text: The aim is to gain a deeper understanding.

links.title: You: ""I am conducting a personal investi..."
links.text: "I am conducting a personal investigation into the world I find myself in."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""How *truly* curious -- a sort of p..."
links.text: "How *truly* curious -- a sort of philosopher-detective!"

links.title: Rhetoric: "Aren't all..."
links.text: Aren't all...

links.title: You: ""Aren't all philosophers detectives?""
links.text: "Aren't all philosophers detectives?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, *all* of them.""
links.text: "Yes, *all* of them."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Except the ones who are philosophe..."
links.text: "Except the ones who are philosophers."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Actually," she turns to the lieute..."
links.text: "Actually," she turns to the lieutenant, "I've heard the analogy made by a blindingly modern school of philosophy called *karperie*. It may not be as far fetched as it sounds."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Why not?" She tosses her head. "I'..."
links.text: "Why not?" She tosses her head. "I've heard the analogy made by a blindingly modern school of philosophy called *karperie*. It may not be as far fetched as it sounds."

links.title: You: ""And aren't all detectives philosop..."
links.text: "And aren't all detectives philosophers?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Naturally," he nods."
links.text: "Naturally," he nods.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Except the ones who are detectives.""
links.text: "Except the ones who are detectives."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""There may be *some* detectives who..."
links.text: "There may be *some* detectives who are not philosophers."

links.title: You: ""I hope my inquiry into the nature..."
links.text: "I hope my inquiry into the nature of reality will ultimately converge with our murder investigation. They are two halves of the same case."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Are they now?" The lieutenant cock..."
links.text: "Are they now?" The lieutenant cocks one eyebrow.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""A deep synthesis," she nods. "I'll..."
links.text: "A deep synthesis," she nods. "I'll assist you however I can then. Go ahead. Ask."

links.title: You: ""Actually.... that's not why I need..."
links.text: "Actually.... that's not why I need you to give me the low-down."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Oh?" You've really piqued her curi..."
links.text: "Oh?" You've really piqued her curiosity now. "Then why?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes." The lieutenant takes a step..."
links.text: "Yes." The lieutenant takes a step closer to you. "Why don't you tell Mrs. Messier what you told me, hmh?"

links.title: Perception (Sight): "A wink. There is a mischievous stre..."
links.text: A wink. There is a mischievous streak to him egging you on. This might go beyond mere strategy.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes!" The lieutenant takes a step..."
links.text: "Yes!" The lieutenant takes a step closer to you, rubbing his hands together. "There is a *stranger* reason, isn't there?"

links.title: You: ""By learning about the world I hope..."
links.text: "By learning about the world I hope to learn more about myself."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""A sort of... spiritual quest? Some..."
links.text: "A sort of... spiritual quest? Something of ancient Iilmaraan origin?" There's more than a trace of irony in her voice.

links.title: You: ""Yes, a spirit quest sounds like th..."
links.text: "Yes, a spirit quest sounds like the thing I'm on."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You will find him a big fan of the..."
links.text: "You will find him a big fan of the *ancient ways* -- it's part of his *condition*."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Nothing wrong with ancient ways,"..."
links.text: "Nothing wrong with ancient ways," she says. "Our *modern* ones aren't necessarily better. Ask away, officer -- I'll help however I can."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Well then. Reality *is* a strange..."
links.text: "Well then. Reality *is* a strange place -- getting stranger by the day. Ask away, officer. I'll help however I can."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "All right. We're in. I know these *..."
links.text: All right. We're in. I know these *all* look good, but begin with the first, okay.

links.title: You: ""Where are we?""
links.text: "Where are we?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""We're in Martinaise, baby.""
links.text: "We're in Martinaise, baby."

links.title: You: ""*Baby?*""
links.text: "*Baby?*"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""A casual term of endearment popula..."
links.text: "A casual term of endearment popular among the 50+ crowd. It's a disco holdover, pay it no heed."

links.title: You: ""I'm a disco holdover myself.""
links.text: "I'm a disco holdover myself."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Ha!" She smiles. "Aren't we all?""
links.text: "Ha!" She smiles. "Aren't we all?"

links.title: Logic: "She refers to your corresponding ag..."
links.text: She refers to your corresponding ages.

links.title: You: ""Mhm. And what is *Martinaise*?""
links.text: "Mhm. And what is *Martinaise*?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Martinaise is a district of Revach..."
links.text: "Martinaise is a district of Revachol." She looks around, her green raincoat flapping in the wind. "A very small district tucked away near the Industrial Harbour. North of the 8/81 and Jamrock."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""You would be excused for not knowi..."
links.text: "You would be excused for not knowing about it. Unimportant, they say. Forgotten even -- shelled to smithereens during the Revolution." She shrugs. "It has its charms, just not this time of year."

links.title: You: ""Tell me more about Martinaise.""
links.text: "Tell me more about Martinaise."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I'm not a good ambassador. I've on..."
links.text: "I'm not a good ambassador. I've only been here once before, as a teenager. Not a lot has changed..." She closes her eyes. "There are ruins, a terminal, fishing boats, reeds. Boys with boxy shoulders."

links.title: Empathy: "A brief spike of longing in her upr..."
links.text: A brief spike of longing in her upright body. The dots under her eyelids shake.

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She opens them: "This place used to..."
links.text: She opens them: "This place used to be a province, a workers' resort before the city swallowed it and the artillery did its work. The reeds are the real star of the show here now. The further down the coast, the wilder it gets."

links.title: You: ""You were here as a teenager?""
links.text: "You were here as a teenager?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes, I was *slumming* it with some..."
links.text: "Yes, I was *slumming* it with some girlfriends of mine. We had boats and..." She smiles. "Don't hold it against me -- the boys certainly did not."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "There is a spark in the air, a live..."
links.text: There is a spark in the air, a live wire hanging in the wind -- in your hung over neocortex. Then the sea air cools it down.

links.title: You: ""You mentioned a sea. What sea is t..."
links.text: "You mentioned a sea. What sea is this?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""It's not really a sea. It's the Ba..."
links.text: "It's not really a sea. It's the Bay of Revachol. And the bay feeds into the ocean."

links.title: You: ""Are we near the ocean?""
links.text: "Are we near the ocean?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes. We are on an island in an oce..."
links.text: "Yes. We are on an island in an ocean. The world's largest body of water -- the Insulindic."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Known to the early Revacholians as..."
links.text: Known to the early Revacholians as *les Immensit√©s Bleues* -- The Blue Immensities.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Vast, lukewarm and unknowable. Flow..."
links.text: Vast, lukewarm and unknowable. Flowing in and out of sight.

links.title: You: ""What's the name of this island?""
links.text: "What's the name of this island?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Caillou." She looks to the waters...."
links.text: "Caillou." She looks to the waters. "Imagine a pebble, a smoothed over pebble amidst a great blue sea. Mis-shapen, cracked. The cracks are the River Esperance. We're in the delta of this river, on the sixth branch -- the Martinaise distributary."

links.title: Empathy: "It is clear this *pebble* is of eno..."
links.text: It is clear this *pebble* is of enormous value to her...

links.title: Conceptualization: "...and to Humanity at large."
links.text: ...and to Humanity at large.

links.title: You: ""Okay, that's Martinaise. What's *R..."
links.text: "Okay, that's Martinaise. What's *Revachol*?" (Continue.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Revachol -- Revachol is what you c..."
links.text: "Revachol -- Revachol is what you call a *city*."

links.title: You: ""What kind of city is Revachol?""
links.text: "What kind of city is Revachol?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""The *Great* kind.""
links.text: "The *Great* kind."

links.title: Inland Empire: "As if it's self-explanatory, beyond..."
links.text: As if it's self-explanatory, beyond patriotism. A fact.

links.title: You: ""What makes Revachol great?""
links.text: "What makes Revachol great?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""History, detective. They built thi..."
links.text: "History, detective. They built this city to *resolve* History -- our part in it at least, our centuries."

links.title: You: ""Okay. *Who* built this city?""
links.text: "Okay. *Who* built this city?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""The nations of the Occident. Or mi..."
links.text: "The nations of the Occident. Or migrant workers from Semenine and Iilmaraa, depending on your creed."

links.title: You: ""*When* was Revachol built?""
links.text: "*When* was Revachol built?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""In the Dolorian century, 380 years..."
links.text: "In the Dolorian century, 380 years ago."

links.title: You: ""And why will it *resolve* History?..."
links.text: "And why will it *resolve* History?" (Continue.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""They say it's where the *terrible*..."
links.text: "They say it's where the *terrible* questions of our time will be answered -- the tensions are highest, the faultlines deepest."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""By that I mean conflicts. Ideologi..."
links.text: "By that I mean conflicts. Ideological conflicts. The stuff of men."

links.title: You: ""Why here?""
links.text: "Why here?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""We are standing on a fertile, self..."
links.text: "We are standing on a fertile, self-sufficient island able to sustain up to 200 million people; in the middle of the Insulindic ocean -- the world's connective tissue..." She smiles. "It's where the money is."

links.title: You: ""So, we're in an unimportant part o..."
links.text: "So, we're in an unimportant part of an important place?"

links.title: You: ""So, we're pretty much at the centr..."
links.text: "So, we're pretty much at the centre of the world?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Oh, we're quite a way off. About....."
links.text: "Oh, we're quite a way off. About..." She points across the water, where the skyscrapers rise...

links.title: You: ""So, we're on the periphery? Basica..."
links.text: "So, we're on the periphery? Basically nobodies?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Speak for yourself, officer. I'm w..."
links.text: "Speak for yourself, officer. I'm well known in certain parts. As to the place, you're right. We are..." She points across the water, where the skyscrapers rise...

links.title: You: ""Tell me about another, perhaps eve..."
links.text: "Tell me about another, perhaps even *more* fundamental aspect of reality."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I would be happy to. What is a pre..."
links.text: "I would be happy to. What is a preposterously expensive education for if not sharing."

links.title: You: ""What is pale?""
links.text: "What is pale?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We've been through this -- ask som..."
links.text: "We've been through this -- ask something else or let's return to work."

links.title: Empathy: "He truly, truly doesn't want you to..."
links.text: He truly, truly doesn't want you to know.

links.title: Conceptualization: "What is it, what is it, what is it?..."
links.text: What is it, what is it, what is it? You can *feel* it -- something pushing against the other side of a locked door. You *must* find the key!

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Go ahead, officer -- ask me someth..."
links.text: "Go ahead, officer -- ask me something *else*." The woman looks at you attentively.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Are you sure you're sure? Your col..."
links.text: "Are you sure you're sure? Your colleague seemed adamant..."

links.title: You: ""Yes -- what is the pale?""
links.text: "Yes -- what is the pale?"

links.title: You: ""Okay, another term then.""
links.text: "Okay, another term then."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course -- ask away." She seems..."
links.text: "Of course -- ask away." She seems slightly relieved.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""The pale is not, technically speak..."
links.text: "The pale is not, technically speaking, part of *reality*..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes," the lieutenant looks at his..."
links.text: "Yes," the lieutenant looks at his watch. "Also, I think we've had enough excitement for today. We *do* have a case to attend to."

links.title: Authority: "His voice is low, but firm. All she..."
links.text: His voice is low, but firm. All she can say is...

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course, lieutenant," she bows,..."
links.text: "Of course, lieutenant," she bows, then turns to you. "Let's try something else."

links.title: You: ""I don't want to. I want to know wh..."
links.text: "I don't want to. I want to know what the pale is."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I don't think your colleague would..."
links.text: "I don't think your colleague would appreciate that -- he has already been so patient with this whole... exercise."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Let's continue with something else..."
links.text: "Let's continue with something else, alright?" She leans against the railing: "You can ask about *anything* else in the world. Anything."

links.title: Suggestion: "But... she wants to tell you."
links.text: But... she wants to tell you.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "You could sneak back -- later, when..."
links.text: You could sneak back -- later, when he's *not* around... unless you can convince him to step aside?

links.title: Rhetoric: "This is not going to happen with th..."
links.text: This is not going to happen with the lieutenant present -- unless you can convince him to step aside.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "You could sneak back, later, when t..."
links.text: You could sneak back, later, when the lieutenant is *not* here... unless you can convince him to step aside?

links.title: You: ""What do you mean it's not part of..."
links.text: "What do you mean it's not part of *reality*?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ma'am." He turns to her again. "Re..."
links.text: "Ma'am." He turns to her again. "Remember, you're dealing with a very *sensitive* and *impressionable* police officer who is still recovering from a recent medical episode."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""The lieutenant's right, let's chan..."
links.text: "The lieutenant's right, let's change topics?" She gives you a little wink: "What do you want to know? Anything!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ma'am." He turns to her again. "Th..."
links.text: "Ma'am." He turns to her again. "This philosophical police detective is very *sensitive* and *impressionable* because of his recent medical episode."

links.title: You: ""Okay then.""
links.text: "Okay then."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant glances at you from..."
links.text: The lieutenant glances at you from the corner of his eye.

links.title: Empathy: "Was he just... worried? That you wo..."
links.text: Was he just... worried? That you would find out something awful?

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""It is the opposite of reality.""
links.text: "It is the opposite of reality."

links.title: You: ""Got it. Tell me something else the..."
links.text: "Got it. Tell me something else then."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course." She seems slightly rel..."
links.text: "Of course." She seems slightly relieved.

links.title: You: ""You said *pale*. What is pale?""
links.text: "You said *pale*. What is pale?"

links.title: You: ""What times are these?""
links.text: "What times are these?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Unimportant, as I said. The minera..."
links.text: "Unimportant, as I said. The mineral rights were all distributed during the Revolution -- as were the bullets to the heads."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I think it's fair to say so. Marti..."
links.text: "I think it's fair to say so. Martinaise is about..." She points across the water, where the skyscrapers rise...

links.title: Perception (Sight): "A sparkle of lights on the night-ti..."
links.text: A sparkle of lights on the night-time horizon, reflected in the dark sea.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Twenty-two kilometres from the cen..."
links.text: "Twenty-two kilometres from the centre of the world. That soldering iron is the Bank of the World building. The bottom floors are INSURCOM -- *Coalition Government* Insulindian Mission Command."

links.title: You: "Look to the sea..."
links.text: Look to the sea...

links.title: Joyce Messier: "Silence. She lowers her hand."
links.text: Silence. She lowers her hand.

links.title: Inland Empire: "The water, the light... It's as tho..."
links.text: The water, the light... It's as though you're seeing it for the *first* time.

links.title: Shivers: "There is no recognition. Only the i..."
links.text: There is no recognition. Only the immensity of the sea, and the cold radiating from it.

links.title: You: ""Where *are* we?""
links.text: "Where *are* we?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""We are where we are. I have no tru..."
links.text: "We are where we are. I have no truer answer to give, unfortunately." She watches you closely as you scan the horizon.

links.title: Inland Empire: "This is one thought you *need* to c..."
links.text: This is one thought you *need* to complete. Where are you?

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Was there something else you wante..."
links.text: "Was there something else you wanted to know? I remember something about a low-down..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This has been informative, thank y..."
links.text: "This has been informative, thank you ma'am. I'm sure my memory-impaired partner has *many* more questions to ask..." He turns to you. "...about even more fundamental aspects of reality..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Might I suggest *not* asking them..."
links.text: "Might I suggest *not* asking them all right now? Ma'am Messier will be here later too. And tomorrow. Isn't that true, ma'am?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Absolutely -- my commitment here i..."
links.text: "Absolutely -- my commitment here is long term."

links.title: You: ""You're right lieutenant. I'll cont..."
links.text: "You're right lieutenant. I'll continue later."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He nods. "It's better not to eat al..."
links.text: He nods. "It's better not to eat all your candy at once."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Indeed. I am always at your servic..."
links.text: "Indeed. I am always at your service."

links.title: You: ""But I want to know everything now.""
links.text: "But I want to know everything now."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That is understandable -- but *per..."
links.text: "That is understandable -- but *perhaps* it's better not to eat all your candy at once?"

links.title: You: ""But won't I be *lazy* if I don't d..."
links.text: "But won't I be *lazy* if I don't do it all now?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Of course not," He shakes his head..."
links.text: "Of course not," He shakes his head. "You're *already* diligent for getting this far -- and diligent boys remember where they left off."

links.title: You: ""I don't know any of this...""
links.text: "I don't know any of this..."

links.title: You: "Say nothing. Observe the large body..."
links.text: Say nothing. Observe the large body of water swelling. Cold...

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She observes your eyes scanning the..."
links.text: She observes your eyes scanning the horizon, then breaks the silence, slowly.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "A sparkle of lights on the horizon,..."
links.text: A sparkle of lights on the horizon, like evening stars above the curvature of the planet.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "A sparkle of lights on the horizon,..."
links.text: A sparkle of lights on the horizon, like morning stars above the curvature of the planet.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "A collection of tall ghosts behind..."
links.text: A collection of tall ghosts behind the water vapour, light reflecting off their glass windows.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""These are... unimportant times, de..."
links.text: "These are... unimportant times, detective." She puts her finger to her lips, then points at you: "You and I were born after the dust had settled, a thousandth of a second too late."

links.title: You: ""Too late for what?""
links.text: "Too late for what?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""For the *Big Time*." Her eyes ligh..."
links.text: "For the *Big Time*." Her eyes light up. There's a flash of teeth.

links.title: Half Light: "The smile of a predator. No doubt w..."
links.text: The smile of a predator. No doubt what she's got in mind.

links.title: You: ""You've got a predatory streak.""
links.text: "You've got a predatory streak."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""All men are predators, dear. Nothi..."
links.text: "All men are predators, dear. Nothing much to be done about *that*. It's all a matter of where you get to file your teeth..."

links.title: You: ""What's the Big Time?""
links.text: "What's the Big Time?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""The Revolution," she says."
links.text: "The Revolution," she says.

links.title: You: ""Hah -- and what *is* this Revoluti..."
links.text: "Hah -- and what *is* this Revolution I keep hearing about?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""It's quite easy: every hundred yea..."
links.text: "It's quite easy: every hundred years or so our species gets together to decide what's next: who gets shot in the head and who gets the mineral rights -- it's a real *kerfuffle*."

links.title: You: ""Got it. Another question, then.""
links.text: "Got it. Another question, then."

links.title: You: ""What is this *acute encephalopathy..."
links.text: "What is this *acute encephalopathy*?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""It's a neurological disorder, caus..."
links.text: "It's a neurological disorder, caused by a lack of vitamin B in the brain. Symptoms include retrograde amnesia. It's... quite serious -- you should get yourself checked out."

links.title: Empathy: "She conveys it in short, cold burst..."
links.text: She conveys it in short, cold bursts, trying not to invest too deeply in the condition of this doomed detective.

links.title: Rhetoric: "In case he goes down later, souring..."
links.text: In case he goes down later, souring the entire portfolio.

links.title: You: ""I know you've got a lot riding on..."
links.text: "I know you've got a lot riding on me. I won't let you down."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""It's not just me, detective. All o..."
links.text: "It's not just me, detective. All of Martinaise has placed its chips on your success. I pray we've all bet wisely."

links.title: You: ""What causes encephalopathy?""
links.text: "What causes encephalopathy?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Well, it's either bariatric surger..."
links.text: "Well, it's either bariatric surgery -- or long term alcohol use."

links.title: You: ""Oh, it's probably from surgery the..."
links.text: "Oh, it's probably from surgery then."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""That seems... unlikely.""
links.text: "That seems... unlikely."

links.title: Electrochemistry: "What this boils down to is this *re..."
links.text: What this boils down to is this *reality* thing is stupid. Blow this joint, grab a bottle and drain that shit right down your throat.

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "Yes, and perform auto-erotic asphyx..."
links.text: Yes, and perform auto-erotic asphyxiation on yourself with your funny neck tie. Out in the open somewhere!

links.title: Drama: "Yes! And *lie* about it too! To her..."
links.text: Yes! And *lie* about it too! To her!

links.title: Volition: "Wait, wait, this *reality thing* is..."
links.text: Wait, wait, this *reality thing* is the only game in town. It's probably in your interest not to blow it.

links.title: You: ""I have, uh, somewhere to party. Ri..."
links.text: "I have, uh, somewhere to party. Right now." [Leave.]

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course," she says, apparently u..."
links.text: "Of course," she says, apparently unsurprised. "Well, I'll be here if you need me."

links.title: You: ""No time for more questions now --..."
links.text: "No time for more questions now -- the art world calls. A performative experiment. You wouldn't understand." [Leave.]

links.title: You: "Wipe that urge from your mind and g..."
links.text: Wipe that urge from your mind and get back to reality.

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She stares at you, head tilted to t..."
links.text: She stares at you, head tilted to the side, with a slightly concerned look on her face.

links.title: You: ""It's definitely the drinking.""
links.text: "It's definitely the drinking."

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She nods, slowly."
links.text: She nods, slowly.

links.title: You: ""Got it. Let me ask something else.""
links.text: "Got it. Let me ask something else."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Be my guest." She takes a sip from..."
links.text: "Be my guest." She takes a sip from her thermal cup.

links.title: You: "What is... (Think of something clos..."
links.text: What is... (Think of something close to you.)

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Six kilometres southwest -- in the..."
links.text: Six kilometres southwest -- in the Valley of Dogs -- junior officer Chad Tillbrook takes aim at a rabid, black dog licking its wounds in the grass.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "To his left, his partner √âmile Moll..."
links.text: To his left, his partner √âmile Mollins whispers: "You heard what happened to Tequila Sunset? In Martinaise?"

links.title: Esprit de Corps: ""Yes, he lost his mind," Tillbrook..."
links.text: "Yes, he lost his mind," Tillbrook answers, finger on the trigger. "Don't worry, √âmile..." He pulls on it slowly. Slowly now... "He'll find it again."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: ""We always do.""
links.text: "We always do."

links.title: You: ""What am *I*?""
links.text: "What am *I*?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""You? You are an officer of the RCM..."
links.text: "You? You are an officer of the RCM," she says energetically.

links.title: You: ""This abbreviation -- what does it..."
links.text: "This abbreviation -- what does it stand for?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""It stands for Revachol Citizens Mi..."
links.text: "It stands for Revachol Citizens Militia."

links.title: You: ""Good. And what is the Revachol Cit..."
links.text: "Good. And what is the Revachol Citizens Militia?"

links.title: You: ""The Revachol Citizens Militia?""
links.text: "The Revachol Citizens Militia?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""*Precisomundo*!""
links.text: "*Precisomundo*!"

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "The price of a 1.5 litre bottle of..."
links.text: The price of a 1.5 litre bottle of Commodore Red? The first line of the Firefighter's Code? Square root of three? I don't know what you mean by *something close to you*. Ask a normal question.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "It remains a mystery what you mean..."
links.text: It remains a mystery what you mean by this *something close*. This isn't about you. It's about *reality*.

links.title: You: ""What was the RCM again?""
links.text: "What was the RCM again?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Nothing more nor less than the de..."
links.text: "Nothing more nor less than the de facto law enforcement body of post-revolutionary Revachol, detective."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes," the lieutenant steps in to m..."
links.text: "Yes," the lieutenant steps in to make a gesture encompassing you both: "*We* are the Revachol Citizens Militia."

links.title: Rhetoric: "He's being sarcastic."
links.text: He's being sarcastic.

links.title: You: ""Are we?""
links.text: "Are we?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We *are*.""
links.text: "We *are*."

links.title: You: ""You said *de facto*?""
links.text: "You said *de facto*?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes. That means: not de jure. The..."
links.text: "Yes. That means: not de jure. The RCM acts in what is poetically called the *twilight of international law*; both at the behest of the Coalition Government -- and to its chagrin."

links.title: You: ""What do you mean?""
links.text: "What do you mean?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""The RCM's responsibilities are def..."
links.text: "The RCM's responsibilities are defined by the Emergency, Wayfarer, and Aliments Acts -- three pieces of legislation keeping the city in a -- let's be honest -- laissez-faire stasis to the benefit of foreign capital."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""All three are good to know," the l..."
links.text: "All three are good to know," the lieutenant looks up from his notes, "when we're out *policing*."

links.title: You: ""So I'm basically a lackey of capit..."
links.text: "So I'm basically a lackey of capital?"

links.title: You: ""So I'm basically a thrall to forei..."
links.text: "So I'm basically a thrall to foreign interests?"

links.title: You: ""So I'm basically a lackey of capit..."
links.text: "So I'm basically a lackey of capital?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""There's nothing *basic* about your..."
links.text: "There's nothing *basic* about your role, detective. It's true that the RCM keeps everything the way our seemingly *permanent* provisional rulers like it..." She leans in.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yet on the other hand -- I know th..."
links.text: "Yet on the other hand -- I know these people. I deal with them daily. Let me tell you, dear, they are not fans of you."

links.title: You: ""Why?""
links.text: "Why?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""The post-revolutionary decade was..."
links.text: "The post-revolutionary decade was a disaster for the Coalition Government. Revachol in the Twenties was hell, especially on the west side of the river: gang warfare, a botched privatisation scheme, a nuclear pile meltdown..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""They called it the *International..."
links.text: "They called it the *International Zone* -- because no nation wanted to claim responsibility. The RCM restored peace where the Coalition failed. A true-blue citizens' initiative," she smiles. "They will never forgive you."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's *somewhat* of an exaggerati..."
links.text: "That's *somewhat* of an exaggeration," the lieutenant interjects. "In reality, ours is a mutually beneficial arrangement."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Revacholians get to keep the peace..."
links.text: "Revacholians get to keep the peace in Revachol, and the Coalition doesn't have to worry about it..." He coughs. "Anyway, sorry to intrude. Please continue."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes, lieutenant. Permit me to conc..."
links.text: "Yes, lieutenant. Permit me to conclude with this -- *who* you are -- to me -- is the police. The only legitimate law enforcement authority in Revachol."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""So, permit me to conclude with thi..."
links.text: "So, permit me to conclude with this -- *who* you are -- to me -- is the police. The only legitimate law enforcement authority in Revachol."

links.title: You: ""Thank you, ma'am.""
links.text: "Thank you, ma'am."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""And if those authorities drink so..."
links.text: "And if those authorities drink so hard they need help recalling the basic terms of reality -- well, I am here to help." She bows and smiles.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""...and if the law officials of our..."
links.text: "...and if the law officials of our nation need help with the basic terms of reality -- well, then I am here to help." She bows.

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: You: ""Back to those basic terms of reali..."
links.text: "Back to those basic terms of reality then."

links.title: You: ""So I'm basically a thrall to forei..."
links.text: "So I'm basically a thrall to foreign interests?"

links.title: You: ""So I'm basically one of the good g..."
links.text: "So I'm basically one of the good guys?"

links.title: You: ""So I'm basically going to avoid th..."
links.text: "So I'm basically going to avoid this subject and ask the next question in this line of inquiry."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Truly moralist of you. The Coaliti..."
links.text: "Truly moralist of you. The Coalition Government would applaud you for staying out of politics. And yet..."

links.title: You: ""That's it for the *who I am* part..."
links.text: "That's it for the *who I am* part then."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Permit me to conclude with this: *..."
links.text: "Permit me to conclude with this: *who* you are -- to me -- is the police. The only legitimate law enforcement authority in Revachol..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""And if those authorities drink so..."
links.text: "And if those authorities drink so hard they need help recalling the basic terms of reality -- well, I am here to help." She bows and smiles.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""...and if the law officials of our..."
links.text: "...and if the law officials of our nation need help with the basic terms of reality -- well, then I am here to help." She bows.

links.title: You: ""What are *you*?""
links.text: "What are *you*?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""What I am *not* is a basic term of..."
links.text: "What I am *not* is a basic term of reality," she smiles.

links.title: Rhetoric: "There may be a way to get her speak..."
links.text: There may be a way to get her speaking about herself -- at some later juncture.

links.title: Suggestion: "Everyone wants to talk about themse..."
links.text: Everyone wants to talk about themselves. She will, in time.

links.title: You: ""I want to know what *you* are.""
links.text: "I want to know what *you* are."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Hmh..." She hums."
links.text: "Hmh..." She hums.

links.title: Volition: "She won't manoeuvre her way out of..."
links.text: She won't manoeuvre her way out of this one.

links.title: You: ""What are you?""
links.text: "What are you?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I am the vilest of the vile," she..."
links.text: "I am the vilest of the vile," she says with a sudden flash of teeth. "A traitor, a devourer of nations and infants..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I am an ultra.""
links.text: "I am an ultra."

links.title: Composure: "She raises the corner of her mouth..."
links.text: She raises the corner of her mouth smirking, revealing a canine.

links.title: Half Light: "It's sharp."
links.text: It's sharp.

links.title: You: ""Wait, what's an ultra?""
links.text: "Wait, what's an ultra?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""An ultraliberal, it's a type of li..."
links.text: "An ultraliberal, it's a type of liberal. From the Revolution. It's... not the moderate kind."

links.title: You: ""Dios m√≠o!" (Draw a cross.) "A LIBE..."
links.text: "Dios m√≠o!" (Draw a cross.) "A LIBERAL!"

links.title: You: ""Cool. I *liberate* pretty hard mys..."
links.text: "Cool. I *liberate* pretty hard myself."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""No," she shakes her head, slowly...."
links.text: "No," she shakes her head, slowly. "Not like me. I am the nether creature of the forbidden swamp, who pushed the king under a *shitwagon* and betrayed the Revolution..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Are you *liberated* enough to offe..."
links.text: "Are you *liberated* enough to offer up your home on a plate for financial colonists?" She looks you in the eye. "No, I think not. Tell me -- now that I've *uncoiled* myself -- do you find me frightening?"

links.title: You: ""I don't understand -- what's so vi..."
links.text: "I don't understand -- what's so vile about that?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Haven't you heard?" She nods, peda..."
links.text: "Haven't you heard?" She nods, pedagogically: "I am a nether creature of the forbidden swamp, one of those who pushed the king under a shitwagon and betrayed the Revolution..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""We surrendered the nation to finan..."
links.text: "We surrendered the nation to financial colonists. No sane person identifies as an *ultra* anymore. Not in broad daylight." She looks you in the eye. "Tell me -- now that I've *uncoiled* myself -- are you repulsed?"

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: You: ""What is this?" (Spread your hands...."
links.text: "What is this?" (Spread your hands.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""A bird?" She tilts her head. "A *s..."
links.text: "A bird?" She tilts her head. "A *sphenicid* -- a flightless bird of the polar regions?"

links.title: You: ""Keep guessing.""
links.text: "Keep guessing."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Some sort of... krill hunter? No,..."
links.text: "Some sort of... krill hunter? No, wait..." Joyce raises her eyebrows. "You're an ancient ruin, a symbol of hubris and decay, half-submerged in some salty sea."

links.title: You: ""Are you saying I'm ruined?""
links.text: "Are you saying I'm ruined?"

links.title: You: ""What -- really?""
links.text: "What -- really?"

links.title: You: ""Am I really that awkward?""
links.text: "Am I really that awkward?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course you're not, my dear. I'm..."
links.text: "Of course you're not, my dear. I'm just terrible at guessing games."

links.title: You: ""Let me ask you something else.""
links.text: "Let me ask you something else."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course," she tosses her permane..."
links.text: "Of course," she tosses her permanent-waved hair. "Ask me anything."

links.title: You: ""I meant what is this *place* here?""
links.text: "I meant what is this *place* here?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""This *place* is an unmarked micros..."
links.text: "This *place* is an unmarked microsettlement on the coast of Martinaise..." She gestures toward a collection of cinderblock dwellings covered by a highly carcinogenic roofing material.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""It's lovely, really. I'm thinking..."
links.text: "It's lovely, really. I'm thinking of buying it."

links.title: You: ""Really?""
links.text: "Really?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes -- so I can spite Evrart and s..."
links.text: "Yes -- so I can spite Evrart and spoil his plans for this place. I'm a petty person, I admit."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Don't worry, I'll never get around..."
links.text: "Don't worry, I'll never get around to it -- the information you pass to me will remain confidential," She waves you off: "Let's get back to reality, shall we?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Actually, yes. The thought did cro..."
links.text: "Actually, yes. The thought did cross my mind when Mademoiselle Lilienne earlier told me about the fresh produce these women sell to restaurants on the Delta."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""This place could use a competent m..."
links.text: "This place could use a competent manager. There's so much to be done. But then, I'll never get around to it, will I?"

links.title: Empathy: "There is regret in her voice -- for..."
links.text: There is regret in her voice -- for all the countless things she never had time to do with her money.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Doubtless I'll be off some place,..."
links.text: "Doubtless I'll be off some place, keeping social classes from each other's throats..." There's a pause. "Let's go back to the basics of reality, shall we?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Actually, yes. The thought did cro..."
links.text: "Actually, yes. The thought did cross my mind when Mademoiselle Lilienne over there told me about the fresh produce these women sell to restaurants on the Delta."

links.title: Lilienne, the Net Picker: "You both turn to consider the young..."
links.text: You both turn to consider the young woman. She's hunched over a net, methodically picking out ribbons of plastic...

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Ah!" She spreads her arms almost a..."
links.text: "Ah!" She spreads her arms almost as wide. "*This* is the pier of Rue de Saint-Ghislaine 33A, where the tenants have been kind enough to rent me a slot..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""...or two." She looks around."
links.text: "...or two." She looks around.

links.title: You: ""What is Rue de Saint-Ghislaine 33A?""
links.text: "What is Rue de Saint-Ghislaine 33A?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""A pre-revolutionary tenement. Old..."
links.text: "A pre-revolutionary tenement. Old buildings are called *tenements*, you see, and new buildings *batiments*, after *les batiments noveau*. But 33A and 33B are not *noveau*, they're old." She looks up at the crumbling facade...

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""This one used to be eight to ten s..."
links.text: "This one used to be eight to ten stories tall -- a real high rise by the standards of the last century. Built to mirror the skyscrapers across the bay in the Delta. That was before the war, of course."

links.title: You: ""Who lived in them?""
links.text: "Who lived in them?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Mostly the urban middle class, I b..."
links.text: "Mostly the urban middle class, I believe. This was once *primo* real estate. Before the cannons lopped four or five stories off..."

links.title: Cindy the SKULL: ""Splat-splat!" From a dilapidated b..."
links.text: "Splat-splat!" From a dilapidated balcony, Cindy the SKULL gives Joyce the evil eye, her red paintbrush held to her throat...

links.title: Perception (Sight): "You could be wrong -- but from here..."
links.text: You could be wrong -- but from here it appears as if she's running the brush *across* her throat, in a sawing motion.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Wonderful.""
links.text: "Wonderful."

links.title: Cindy the SKULL: ""Splat-splat!" From a dilapidated b..."
links.text: "Splat-splat!" From a dilapidated balcony, a young girl in odd clothes gives Joyce the evil eye, a red paintbrush held to her throat...

links.title: You: ""What is that?" (Point to Cindy the..."
links.text: "What is that?" (Point to Cindy the SKULL.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""The girl in the old-lady rags?""
links.text: "The girl in the old-lady rags?"

links.title: You: ""Yes.""
links.text: "Yes."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Looks like a sullen and rebellious..."
links.text: "Looks like a sullen and rebellious member of a teen *infraculture*."

links.title: You: ""Infra... culture?""
links.text: "Infra... culture?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes -- you and I belong to the sup..."
links.text: "Yes -- you and I belong to the supraculture. We're common, the herd. The music on the radio, the food in the chain restaurant -- those are all too *popular* for the girl in the old-lady rags."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""She prefers a fantasy world -- an..."
links.text: "She prefers a fantasy world -- an *infraculture* with its own dress code and vernacular. It is an illusion, I'm afraid. There is no refuge from the supraculture."

links.title: You: ""Okay, now explain the same thing -..."
links.text: "Okay, now explain the same thing -- but to a child."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Young people who dye their hair fu..."
links.text: "Young people who dye their hair funny colours and wear old people's clothes are stupid and their little rebellion is self-defeating..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She pauses to take a long, leisurel..."
links.text: She pauses to take a long, leisurely sip of tea. "Alright, what next?"

links.title: Conceptualization: "Suddenly you're not so sure *you're..."
links.text: Suddenly you're not so sure *you're* part of the supraculture...

links.title: You: ""I think *I* may be part of an infr..."
links.text: "I think *I* may be part of an infraculture."

links.title: Joyce Messier: "Her eyes go round with surprise. "A..."
links.text: Her eyes go round with surprise. "And what would *that* be?"

links.title: You: ""Cop.""
links.text: "Cop."

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She lets out an unrestrained laugh,..."
links.text: She lets out an unrestrained laugh, the crows feet stretching onto her cheeks...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""My reality-impaired colleague is n..."
links.text: "My reality-impaired colleague is not so far off..." The lieutenant wanders back into the conversation -- he's been sorting his notes.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Many of the RCM's fashions, even w..."
links.text: "Many of the RCM's fashions, even weapon preferences, borrow heavily from classic Vespertine cop shows. My precinct alone has three officers who go by the name *Ace*..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""But please -- do continue this rea..."
links.text: "But please -- do continue this reality-exploration. I was just remarking."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes, let's..." She settles down --..."
links.text: "Yes, let's..." She settles down -- still a quivering smile on her face.

links.title: You: ""What's so funny about that?""
links.text: "What's so funny about that?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Nothing, nothing, it's just..." Sh..."
links.text: "Nothing, nothing, it's just..." She wipes a tear from her eye. "True, that's all. The uniforms, the language... Let's have another question about reality, shall we?"

links.title: You: ""Disco.""
links.text: "Disco."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Ha! I can see that, yes. I dabbled..."
links.text: "Ha! I can see that, yes. I dabbled in those dark arts myself -- not so long ago." She smiles enigmatically. "I assure you, it was a thoroughly *supracultural* phenomenon. All-permeating. Downright mandatory."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Nothing *infra* about disco, baby.""
links.text: "Nothing *infra* about disco, baby."

links.title: You: ""You're disco?""
links.text: "You're disco?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Those days are long behind me..."..."
links.text: "Those days are long behind me..." She looks inland with sarcastic wistfulness. "And even in the early Thirties I would say I was more of a *New* girl. Disco was a minor, but still enjoyable facet of the whole thing for me."

links.title: You: ""I don't know, I just feel it.""
links.text: "I don't know, I just feel it."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Ah, yes. That is what counts, I su..."
links.text: "Ah, yes. That is what counts, I suppose. For my part, I was more of a *New* girl."

links.title: You: ""The *New*?""
links.text: "The *New*?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""The New, a cultural era -- and the..."
links.text: "The New, a cultural era -- and the name of the decade it ravished, the Thirties. It came out of post-revolutionary Revachol. It was... ultraliberal."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""It involved *lots* of partying, as..."
links.text: "It involved *lots* of partying, as you might imagine. And champagne coloured *everything*. By the looks of it -- that would have been when you came of age. Now..." She raises her eyebrow at you.

links.title: You: ""Sounds fun. I can't remember a sin..."
links.text: "Sounds fun. I can't remember a single thing."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Wasn't it Guillaume le Million who..."
links.text: "Wasn't it Guillaume le Million who said: *If you can remember the New, you weren't there*?"

links.title: You: ""Wait -- Guillaume le Million? I wa..."
links.text: "Wait -- Guillaume le Million? I was just thinking about that guy! Whatever happened to him?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Ah, yes..." She looks hesitant. "T..."
links.text: "Ah, yes..." She looks hesitant. "This is not very *central* to reality, is it?"

links.title: You: ""I still want to know.""
links.text: "I still want to know."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I can't be one hundred percent sur..."
links.text: "I can't be one hundred percent sure, but I believe he died due to complications from venereal disease."

links.title: You: ""Which one?""
links.text: "Which one?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""*All* of them.""
links.text: "*All* of them."

links.title: You: ""Are you sure he didn't die of auto..."
links.text: "Are you sure he didn't die of auto-erotic asphyxiation?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""You can't get a venereal disease f..."
links.text: "You can't get a venereal disease from that, can you?"

links.title: You: ""So you're saying he *didn't* vanis..."
links.text: "So you're saying he *didn't* vanish in a  puff of stardust?" (Conclude.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I'm afraid no, but then again -- o..."
links.text: "I'm afraid no, but then again -- one can't be entirely sure. It's all part of his *mystique*. Ask someone else and you may get a more champagne-coloured take..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Anyway," she concludes. "What othe..."
links.text: "Anyway," she concludes. "What other basic facets of reality should we discuss?"

links.title: Encyclopedia: "For some reason your mind is a veri..."
links.text: For some reason your mind is a veritable repository of Guillaume le Million lyrics, trivia, and b-sides. But the time to explore this is when you're alone, facing a mirror perhaps? Right now it would derail the reality low-down.

links.title: You: ""Champagne? That doesn't sound like..."
links.text: "Champagne? That doesn't sound like anything *I'd* be into. I'm straight edge."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course. You're much more *groun..."
links.text: "Of course. You're much more *grounded*, a serious detective on a case called *reality*. Speaking of -- is there anything else?"

links.title: You: ""Got it -- let's take it back to re..."
links.text: "Got it -- let's take it back to reality central for the next one."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Maximum brio, officer.""
links.text: "Maximum brio, officer."

links.title: You: ""We got this covered -- about anoth..."
links.text: "We got this covered -- about another basic reality term."

links.title: You: "Let it go."
links.text: Let it go.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Of course -- no time for silly infr..."
links.text: Of course -- no time for silly infracultures. There are more pressing, reality-centric questions to be asked.

links.title: You: ""I understand everything. Make it m..."
links.text: "I understand everything. Make it more complicated somehow."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I can't. That's how simple it is...."
links.text: "I can't. That's how simple it is. One may dye their hair green and wear their grandma's coat all they want. Capital has the ability to subsume all critiques into itself. Even those who would *critique* capital end up *reinforcing* it instead..."

links.title: You: ""No, no, I meant something basic ab..."
links.text: "No, no, I meant something basic about reality."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Ah, yes. There's something very sa..."
links.text: "Ah, yes. There's something very satisfying about discussing the fundamental facts of reality. Go ahead."

links.title: You: ""What *world* is this?""
links.text: "What *world* is this?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""What world?" The fading pearls of..."
links.text: "What world?" The fading pearls of her eyes look to the sea. "The only one, I suppose -- the world of matter and its pale antipode..."

links.title: Inland Empire: "The camera of her mind glides over..."
links.text: The camera of her mind glides over the surface of the water.

links.title: You: ""What do you see?""
links.text: "What do you see?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Great bodies of water, forest-cove..."
links.text: "Great bodies of water, forest-covered surfaces... clusters of light where the cities lie. You've seen the montage, we all have -- this world is enough," she concludes.

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of bodies of water and forest-cove..."
links.text: "Of bodies of water and forest-covered surfaces, clusters of light where the cities lie. You've seen the montage, we all have -- this world is enough," she concludes.

links.title: Conceptualization: "It *must* be. This is the greatest..."
links.text: It *must* be. This is the greatest and kindest arrangement the atoms had in them.

links.title: Shivers: "A frisson lifts the hair on the bac..."
links.text: A frisson lifts the hair on the back of your arm. Wind sweeps the surface of the bay.

links.title: You: ""The wind is sweeping the waters...""
links.text: "The wind is sweeping the waters..."

links.title: Shivers: "THE WORLD IS A SUZERAINTY"
links.text: THE WORLD IS A SUZERAINTY

links.title: Shivers: "OF REVACHOL."
links.text: OF REVACHOL.

links.title: You: ""The best of all possible worlds.""
links.text: "The best of all possible worlds."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Indeed. There is a term of endearm..."
links.text: "Indeed. There is a term of endearment they coined for it. In the Dolorian century, when humanity was *high* on this world, discovering more and more of it -- these archipelagos included..."

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""There is a term of endearment they..."
links.text: "There is a term of endearment they coined for it. In the Dolorian century, when humanity was *high* on this world, discovering more and more of it -- these archipelagos included..."

links.title: You: ""What is it?""
links.text: "What is it?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Elysium.""
links.text: "Elysium."

links.title: You: ""Wait, is this the one with the evi..."
links.text: "Wait, is this the one with the evil apes?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Not in this case, no. That sounds..."
links.text: "Not in this case, no. That sounds more like something the Mesque petrofascists might say..." Her gaze wanders.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The Confederate Republic of Mesque..."
links.text: The Confederate Republic of Mesque -- the world's largest state by territory -- has fallen into an especially nihilistic strain of nationalism lately.

links.title: Joyce Messier: "Her eyes return to you. "It isn't e..."
links.text: Her eyes return to you. "It isn't enough to call us animals. Even animals aren't animals."

links.title: You: ""What are animals then?""
links.text: "What are animals then?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""They're like you and I, I suppose...."
links.text: "They're like you and I, I suppose. Living organisms don't identify with abstractions. Elysium is for particular beings."

links.title: You: ""Elysium... The world needs a term..."
links.text: "Elysium... The world needs a term of endearment."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""It does. There are those who would..."
links.text: "It does. There are those who would call it *Hell*..."

links.title: You: ""What is *Hell?*""
links.text: "What is *Hell?*"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""A term of hatred that originates,..."
links.text: "A term of hatred that originates, like many such things, with the Mesque petrofascists."

links.title: You: ""I don't feel like I have got the w..."
links.text: "I don't feel like I have got the whole picture yet."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Oh, you want a *picture* of the wo..."
links.text: "Oh, you want a *picture* of the world?" She raises her finger to her lips. "There is no complete set yet, dear. They're having some trouble reaching orbit."

links.title: You: ""How come?""
links.text: "How come?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Great things are difficult to achi..."
links.text: "Great things are difficult to achieve. For now, we're viewing the world from the inside -- sideways."

links.title: You: ""How about -- it's a ball.""
links.text: "How about -- it's a ball."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""That's looking less and less likel..."
links.text: "That's looking less and less likely, detective. You wouldn't know it from the tabloids, but the ORG nations have been launching weather balloons into the lower ionosphere since the Thirties."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "ORG: Occident-Revachol-Graad."
links.text: ORG: Occident-Revachol-Graad.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""There's a steadily increasing tric..."
links.text: "There's a steadily increasing trickle of images. Between the big three they're piecing together a dark grey corona."

links.title: You: ""A dark grey corona?""
links.text: "A dark grey corona?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes." She pauses. "Pale covers 72%..."
links.text: "Yes." She pauses. "Pale covers 72% of the surface. There are grey flares and prominences, even arcs above entire isolas... The images are blurry, but if there was a sphere in there it certainly looks like it fractured a long time ago."

links.title: Half Light: "A cold fear seeps into you."
links.text: A cold fear seeps into you.

links.title: You: ""Oh my god, wait -- what the hell a..."
links.text: "Oh my god, wait -- what the hell are you telling me?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""You seem to be spooked. Please don..."
links.text: "You seem to be spooked. Please don't be." Her voice becomes homely, calm. She lets a moment pass.

links.title: You: ""The pale...? And what do you mean..."
links.text: "The pale...? And what do you mean *corona*?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""They say there is a rarefied envel..."
links.text: "They say there is a rarefied envelope of matter surrounding the darkened disc of our planet. That is, if we are still living on a planet. Or, to speak more plainly, imagine vast swathes of land disrupted by nothingness."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I am sorry, dear," she looks aroun..."
links.text: "I am sorry, dear," she looks around. "It must sound quite terrifying through the acute encephalopathy. Even scientific positivism isn't entirely convinced about what we're dealing with here..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""But -- this is one of the great qu..."
links.text: "But -- this is one of the great questions of our time. Maybe when they get the complete set together it will jolt us out of our rut -- bring us together. However naive it may sound."

links.title: You: ""A fractured corona doesn't feel li..."
links.text: "A fractured corona doesn't feel like it's gonna bring anyone *together*."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""You have mis-imagined it. I don't..."
links.text: "You have mis-imagined it. I don't have the power to convey to you the effect and geometry of the images that depict our world from below low orbit. It's..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She looks up: "It's like the crowni..."
links.text: She looks up: "It's like the crowning of the world. It's insane. Very *disco*. You'd love it."

links.title: You: ""Well, if you say it's disco...""
links.text: "Well, if you say it's disco..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""See? Everyone finds something wort..."
links.text: "See? Everyone finds something worth holding onto in this world -- however wasted its opportunities."

links.title: Shivers: "The cold seeps into you. The air is..."
links.text: The cold seeps into you. The air is heavy with 80% humidity.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Suddenly you're conscious of yourse..."
links.text: Suddenly you're conscious of yourself standing there, on... whatever this all is. Your arms hang down by your sides.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant observes you both, s..."
links.text: The lieutenant observes you both, silently. He adjusts his glasses.

links.title: You: ""Doesn't sound like any kind of dis..."
links.text: "Doesn't sound like any kind of disco I'd like to go to."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""But you already have," she looks a..."
links.text: "But you already have," she looks around. "And you're doing just fine, despite the rubble."

links.title: You: ""I don't care about disco, I only c..."
links.text: "I don't care about disco, I only care about the Commune."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""See? Everyone finds something wort..."
links.text: "See? Everyone finds something worth holding onto in the world -- however wasted its opportunities."

links.title: You: ""Okay. And then everything will be..."
links.text: "Okay. And then everything will be okay?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I don't know about things of that..."
links.text: "I don't know about things of that scale, my expertise lies in nations and trade routes, one or several layers below *everything*."

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She thinks. "But yes, you'll be fin..."
links.text: She thinks. "But yes, you'll be fine, don't worry."

links.title: Empathy: "She does not seem convinced that yo..."
links.text: She does not seem convinced that you'll be fine. If anything, she is realizing how deep your condition runs.

links.title: You: ""It certainly doesn't feel like I'm..."
links.text: "It certainly doesn't feel like I'm fine."

links.title: You: ""Thanks. Okay.""
links.text: "Thanks. Okay."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""You *may* have mis-imagined it. I..."
links.text: "You *may* have mis-imagined it. I don't have the power to convey to you the effect and geometry of the images that depict our world from below low orbit. It's..."

links.title: You: ""Okay, forget all this stuff. Let m..."
links.text: "Okay, forget all this stuff. Let me ask something else."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes!" She claps her hands for warm..."
links.text: "Yes!" She claps her hands for warmth.

links.title: Empathy: "She does not seem convinced that yo..."
links.text: She does not seem convinced that you'll be fine. If anything, she is realizing this whole reality low-down is less *philosophical* than you've led on.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I am sorry, detective," she looks..."
links.text: "I am sorry, detective," she looks around. "Philosophically speaking -- it must sound *quite terrifying*. Even scientific positivism isn't entirely convinced about what we're dealing with here..."

links.title: You: ""Inside sideways? What *shape* is t..."
links.text: "Inside sideways? What *shape* is this world then?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""We used to think it was a sphere,..."
links.text: "We used to think it was a sphere, but that is beginning to look less and less likely by the day. You wouldn't know it from the tabloids, but the ORG nations have been launching weather balloons into the lower ionosphere since the Thirties."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "ORG: Occident-Revachol-Graad."
links.text: ORG: Occident-Revachol-Graad.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""There's a steadily increasing tric..."
links.text: "There's a steadily increasing trickle of images. Between the big three scientific contributors, they're piecing together a dark grey corona."

links.title: You: ""I've got a clear picture. Let's pr..."
links.text: "I've got a clear picture. Let's proceed to another term."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Let's. I am, after all, bourgeois..."
links.text: "Let's. I am, after all, bourgeois and female -- hardly the perfect ambassador for the world."

links.title: You: ""This world does not deserve a term..."
links.text: "This world does not deserve a term of endearment."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""There are those who would call it..."
links.text: "There are those who would call it *Hell*..."

links.title: You: "What is... (Reach for something fun..."
links.text: What is... (Reach for something fundamental.)

links.title: Conceptualization: "What is... all of this? The scent,..."
links.text: What is... all of this? The scent, the sound, the air?

links.title: Conceptualization: "A strange coldness comes over you,..."
links.text: A strange coldness comes over you, as you look at the world. The waves sway the sloop, slowly. That's all.

links.title: Conceptualization: "The doubt is fully formed in your h..."
links.text: The doubt is fully formed in your head -- the alien feeling persists -- yet something's still missing. You have finished mulling over the *Jamais Vu* thought, but your Conceptualization skills are not nuanced enough to make sense of it...

links.title: Conceptualization: "The doubt is fully formed in your h..."
links.text: The doubt is fully formed in your head -- the alien feeling persists -- you just can't *word* the question yet. You have to complete the *Jamais Vu* thought first.

links.title: Conceptualization: "It's on the tip of your tongue -- a..."
links.text: It's on the tip of your tongue -- a *doubt* of sorts, already in your head -- but it's not fully formed yet. You have to wait and return to this later, once the *Jamais Vu* thought is complete.

links.title: You: "Ask for Kim to step away while you..."
links.text: Ask for Kim to step away while you discuss the pale.

links.title: Volition: "Good idea. Just ask him. He won't m..."
links.text: Good idea. Just ask him. He won't make a scene.

links.title: You: ""Kim, can I talk to the ma'am alone..."
links.text: "Kim, can I talk to the ma'am alone for a second?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Fine." He steps away with his note..."
links.text: "Fine." He steps away with his notes.

links.title: Volition: "See? What can he do. You're a grown..."
links.text: See? What can he do. You're a grown man.

links.title: You: ""Now -- what is the pale?""
links.text: "Now -- what is the pale?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Fine." He steps away with his note..."
links.text: "Fine." He steps away with his notes.

links.title: Volition: "Yeah, you still aren't over the fea..."
links.text: Yeah, you still aren't over the fear that something bad might happen. He expressly said you've had enough excitement for today.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes?" She's waiting for another te..."
links.text: "Yes?" She's waiting for another term.

links.title: Volition: "...is what you want to do. But shou..."
links.text: ...is what you want to do. But should you? He expressly stated you shouldn't hear about it. What if it renders you mad? Or catatonic? *Or* makes you lose your memory again?

links.title: You: ""That's all for now." (Conclude for..."
links.text: "That's all for now." (Conclude for now.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Glad to have been of assistance --..."
links.text: "Glad to have been of assistance -- the little that I know.... anything else?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes," she nods slowly. "I am the n..."
links.text: "Yes," she nods slowly. "I am the nether creature of the forbidden swamp. I pushed the king under a *shitwagon* and betrayed the Revolution. My kind surrendered the nation to financial colonists..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Perhaps you thought we'd gone exti..."
links.text: "Perhaps you thought we'd gone extinct. After all, no sane person identifies as an *ultra* anymore. Not in broad daylight." She looks into your eye. "Tell me -- now that I've *uncoiled* myself -- are you repulsed?"

links.title: Empathy: "In her green eyes you see a mixture..."
links.text: In her green eyes you see a mixture of truth and self-satire. Decades of guilt *and* pride.

links.title: Suggestion: "Forgive her."
links.text: Forgive her.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "But only because you like pearlesce..."
links.text: But only because you like pearlescent teeth and those light green eyes...

links.title: You: ""You're a monster.""
links.text: "You're a monster."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""That's a pity," she bows. "I hope..."
links.text: "That's a pity," she bows. "I hope we can remain collegial despite my monstrousness. The ultras didn't have anything against the king *or* the Commune, you see. It was just business."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Honestly..." she pauses. "I may ha..."
links.text: "Honestly..." she pauses. "I may have even *preferred* it, had the communards won. Who knows? They might really have built something better. But they didn't, because they lost."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""When the dust settled, the liberal..."
links.text: "When the dust settled, the liberals were the only ones left to clean up the mess. By virtue of their survival they were handed enormous power to shape the future..." She turns her gaze to the delta. "This was all our last generation managed."

links.title: You: ""Would *you* have done something di..."
links.text: "Would *you* have done something differently?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""With due respect to our overlords,..."
links.text: "With due respect to our overlords, the eternal *caretaker* government that keeps Martinaise a monument to the efficacy of its artillery..."

links.title: Authority: "An appropriate warning to those who..."
links.text: An appropriate warning to those who'd cross the line and pull the city into madness once more...

links.title: Shivers: "While a gentle wind sweeps the stre..."
links.text: While a gentle wind sweeps the streets in the rebuilt East, light drizzle washing it clean, lights go up and motor carriages circulate the tracts...

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I would not have relinquished sove..."
links.text: "I would not have relinquished sovereignty to the Coalition. Not here in Martinaise -- and not in the Stella Maris or Delta beachheads either. If not for my own sake..."

links.title: Composure: "She realizes her small, cold fists..."
links.text: She realizes her small, cold fists are clenched. She loosens them.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""... then for my daughters'. We had..."
links.text: "... then for my daughters'. We had an obligation to defend our sovereignty. We should have *burned* the whole isola down rather than let them have it."

links.title: Inland Empire: "Dark orange flames reflect in her g..."
links.text: Dark orange flames reflect in her green eyes. An oil fire on the ocean.

links.title: You: ""You're a smart woman.""
links.text: "You're a smart woman."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Perhaps." Her earrings chime as sh..."
links.text: "Perhaps." Her earrings chime as she nods. "My intellectual vanity will be my undoing."

links.title: Logic: "You're no dummy yourself."
links.text: You're no dummy yourself.

links.title: You: ""So am I.""
links.text: "So am I."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""A smart boy getting smarter, one b..."
links.text: "A smart boy getting smarter, one basic term of reality at a time..."

links.title: You: "No -- or intellectual vanity will b..."
links.text: No -- or intellectual vanity will be *my* undoing!

links.title: Logic: "And the crown on your head as you l..."
links.text: And the crown on your head as you lay in the casket.

links.title: You: ""You're a patriot?""
links.text: "You're a patriot?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes, I suppose I am. But I wouldn'..."
links.text: "Yes, I suppose I am. But I wouldn't be a patriot anywhere but here."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Seditious talk, ma'am." The lieute..."
links.text: "Seditious talk, ma'am." The lieutenant puts down his notes and gives her a look.

links.title: You: ""You have daughters?" (Conclude.)"
links.text: "You have daughters?" (Conclude.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes, whatever else I am, I'm also..."
links.text: "Yes, whatever else I am, I'm also a mother. And a wife." She closes her eyes, then opens them again. "Now -- shall we return to reality?"

links.title: You: ""That settles that.""
links.text: "That settles that."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Nothing's settled. It simply fades..."
links.text: "Nothing's settled. It simply fades away..." She closes her eyes. "Like a lover who has lost their faith. Now, shall we return to reality?"

links.title: You: ""I forgive you.""
links.text: "I forgive you."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I do hope so," she bows. "I hope w..."
links.text: "I do hope so," she bows. "I hope we are able to remain collegial despite my monstrousness. The ultras didn't have anything against the king *or* the Commune, you see. It was just business."

links.title: You: ""I forgive you -- but only because..."
links.text: "I forgive you -- but only because you're charming."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""*A Deuill*," she pronounces: "*Who..."
links.text: "*A Deuill*," she pronounces: "*Who being of great Charme and Guille, sneaketh into the homes of the Godlie*."

links.title: Conceptualization: "That dialect is Ubi Sunt?. You reco..."
links.text: That dialect is Ubi Sunt?. You recognize the quote from somewhere. A play, written way back in the Franconigerian century...

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Beneath her waterproof raincoat and..."
links.text: Beneath her waterproof raincoat and silk shirt is a body imbibed in Numb 12 perfume. You are suddenly and intimately aware of it.

links.title: You: ""*And perswades them to addict them..."
links.text: "*And perswades them to addict themselues to his seruice...*"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Ah, you know more than you let on...."
links.text: "Ah, you know more than you let on..." She gives you a coy little smile. "Philosopher-Detective of Precinct 41."

links.title: You: ""Vile Deuill." (Shake your head slo..."
links.text: "Vile Deuill." (Shake your head slowly.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I hope we are able to continue as..."
links.text: "I hope we are able to continue as friends despite my scaly bulk. And the treacheries committed by my people against the Suzerain and the Commune."

links.title: You: "(Nod.) "Devil Woman.""
links.text: (Nod.) "Devil Woman."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I'm afraid you'll find that *every..."
links.text: "I'm afraid you'll find that *every* woman is a Devil Woman, detective. There are only *aesthetic* differences between one and the other."

links.title: You: ""Wanna... fuck?""
links.text: "Wanna... fuck?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""...steal, kill and destroy?" She c..."
links.text: "...steal, kill and destroy?" She counters, quick as a whip. "That they say we've been doing for over four decades now. Perhaps regrettably, I've had my fill for this century..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hmh," the lieutenant hums, reading..."
links.text: "Hmh," the lieutenant hums, reading his notes.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""In any case, I'm glad we can remai..."
links.text: "In any case, I'm glad we can remain collegial despite my scaly bulk. And my perverse need to infiltrate and betray both Kingdom *and* Revolution."

links.title: You: ""I don't care.""
links.text: "I don't care."

links.title: Suggestion: "You *feel* that she won't like the..."
links.text: You *feel* that she won't like the answer -- just as it's leaving your lips. Even more -- it will hurt her.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""A fitting punishment," she smirks...."
links.text: "A fitting punishment," she smirks. "To be forgotten, if not forgiven. Save a prayer for us in our *ch√¢teaus* on Ozonne and in Stella Maris."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Glad to have been of assistance --..."
links.text: "Glad to have been of assistance -- the little that I know. Anything else I can do?"

links.title: Suggestion: "All right. You're in. Begin with th..."
links.text: All right. You're in. Begin with the first one -- you'll appear *worldly*.

links.title: You: ""None of that foreign wisdom. I onl..."
links.text: "None of that foreign wisdom. I only seek deep, ancient PATRIOTIC truths."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You will find he doesn't approve o..."
links.text: "You will find he doesn't approve of foreign wisdom. It's part of his *condition*."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I've never heard of a *nationalist..."
links.text: "I've never heard of a *nationalistic* medical condition, but then reality is a strange place. Ask away, officer -- I'll help however I can."

links.title: You: ""Forget the past, my quest concerns..."
links.text: "Forget the past, my quest concerns the coming apocalypse."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You will find that *most* things c..."
links.text: "You will find that *most* things concern the coming apocalypse. It's part of his *condition*."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I've never heard of an *apocalypti..."
links.text: "I've never heard of an *apocalyptic* medical condition, but then reality is a strange place. Ask away, officer -- I'll help however I can."

links.title: You: ""Actually... that is not why I need..."
links.text: "Actually... that is not why I need a low-down."

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She nods, attentively."
links.text: She nods, attentively.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes." The lieutenant takes a step..."
links.text: "Yes." The lieutenant takes a step closer to you. "Why don't you tell Mrs. Messier what you told me, hm?"

links.title: Perception: "He gives you a slight nudge on your..."
links.text: He gives you a slight nudge on your side, apparently enjoying himself.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes!" The lieutenant takes a step..."
links.text: "Yes!" The lieutenant takes a step closer to you, rubbing his hands together. "There is a *stranger* reason, isn't there?"

links.title: You: ""It's related to that *medical epis..."
links.text: "It's related to that *medical episode* -- I have trouble remembering even the most basic terms of reality."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Ah, yes -- the *episode*. Sounds l..."
links.text: "Ah, yes -- the *episode*. Sounds like an acute case of encephalopathy now that I think of it..." She puts down her thermal cup and looks at you.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Don't be fazed, madam. He function..."
links.text: "Don't be fazed, madam. He functions perfectly well. He only needs a... *lowdown* on all of reality."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""We may be here awhile, then." She..."
links.text: "We may be here awhile, then." She takes a long sip of tea. "Ask away, officer -- I'll help however I can."

links.title: Composure: "Trying to gauge by your expression..."
links.text: Trying to gauge by your expression and demeanour whether you're joking. She concludes you're not.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""But then, I'm no doctor." She take..."
links.text: "But then, I'm no doctor." She takes a long sip of tea. "Ask away, officer -- I'll help however I can."

links.title: You: ""I got so drunk I forgot literally..."
links.text: "I got so drunk I forgot literally everything."

links.title: Joyce Messier: "*"What?"* She chortles, nearly spil..."
links.text: *"What?"* She chortles, nearly spilling her tea.

links.title: You: ""I went on a three-day bender and n..."
links.text: "I went on a three-day bender and now need you to explain the world to me."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Such an acute encephalopathy... ju..."
links.text: "Such an acute encephalopathy... just doesn't seem possible." She puts her beverage down and stares at you. "Surely you're joking..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Don't be fazed, madam. He function..."
links.text: "Don't be fazed, madam. He functions perfectly well. He only needs a... *lowdown* on all of reality."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""We may be here awhile, then." She..."
links.text: "We may be here awhile, then." She takes a long sip to clear her throat. "Ask away, officer -- I'll help however I can."

links.title: Composure: "She's trying to see whether you're..."
links.text: She's trying to see whether you're bluffing -- it's easy not to fidget. You're *not*.
