links.title: Empathy: "This person is not easily disorient..."
links.text: This person is not easily disoriented, but you've done it.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""No. You're not joking at all, are..."
links.text: "No. You're not joking at all, are you?" She sighs. "Well, ask away, officer -- I'll help however I can."

links.title: You: ""I woke up in a trashed hotel room,..."
links.text: "I woke up in a trashed hotel room, superstar-style. Before that everything's a blank."

links.title: You: ""A supra-natural event took place."..."
links.text: "A supra-natural event took place." (Point to your head.) "Within my head -- on alcohol."

links.title: You: ""Please don't make me say it again.""
links.text: "Please don't make me say it again."

links.title: You: ""No time to explain -- just give me..."
links.text: "No time to explain -- just give me the low-down."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""No, but... please. A *little* cont..."
links.text: "No, but... please. A *little* context. We're not in such a hurry."

links.title: Rhetoric: "We have time for you to tell me why..."
links.text: We have time for you to tell me why you need a *reality lowdown*.

links.title: You: ""Actually -- now is not a good time..."
links.text: "Actually -- now is not a good time for a reality low-down. Maybe later."

links.title: You: ""Okay, but... what *is* it? A defin..."
links.text: "Okay, but... what *is* it? A definition..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Okay." She concedes. "The pale is..."
links.text: "Okay." She concedes. "The pale is the most dominant geological feature of the world, detective -- the separative tissue between the isolas. It is the interisolary mass."

links.title: Endurance: "Your stomach grumbles approvingly....."
links.text: Your stomach grumbles approvingly... the reality rhizome is opening up before your very eyes.

links.title: You: ""Wait, and what is an isola?""
links.text: "Wait, and what is an isola?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""*Isola* is a Messinian word for a..."
links.text: "*Isola* is a Messinian word for a continent of matter, enveloped on all sides by the pale. Also: isolation, or land mass. We used to believe there was only one. In the last four centuries we have discovered seven..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Mundi, Seol, Samara, Iilmaraa, Gra..."
links.text: "Mundi, Seol, Samara, Iilmaraa, Graad, Katla, and this -- Insulinde."

links.title: You: ""And Insulinde is...?""
links.text: "And Insulinde is...?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""An oceanic isola. It comprises mos..."
links.text: "An oceanic isola. It comprises mostly of water. Mundi is the largest, Katla the coldest, Insulinde the bluest. What can I say..." She stops. "Each is perishing and dear."

links.title: You: ""Okay... what is the pale *like*?""
links.text: "Okay... what is the pale *like*?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Achromatic, odourless, featureless..."
links.text: "Achromatic, odourless, featureless. The pale is the enemy of matter and life. It is not *like* any other -- or *any* thing in the world. It is the transition state of being into nothingness."

links.title: Logic: "The negation of being."
links.text: The negation of being.

links.title: You: ""The negation of...""
links.text: "The negation of..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""That's right -- the negation of be..."
links.text: "That's right -- the negation of being." She tightens her hood around her neck, it's cold outside.

links.title: You: ""Is it... here?" (Look around.)"
links.text: "Is it... here?" (Look around.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""No, detective, we're safe." She po..."
links.text: "No, detective, we're safe." She points to the sea. "It begins there, 6,000 kilometres to the north, and even more to the south, east, and west. You are in the middle of the isola."

links.title: Inland Empire: "As your gaze instinctively turns no..."
links.text: As your gaze instinctively turns north, a small black pit opens up in your stomach.

links.title: You: ""Six thousand kilometres from the e..."
links.text: "Six thousand kilometres from the end of the world?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes -- that is enough. Many cities..."
links.text: "Yes -- that is enough. Many cities are built *much* closer."

links.title: You: ""And... (point north) ...there?""
links.text: "And... (point north) ...there?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""An uproar of matter, darling, *ris..."
links.text: "An uproar of matter, darling, *rising* into the pale. Rolling. Evaporating even, a great vision. The area of transition between the world and the pale is called *porch collapse*."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Imagine a grey coronal mist, cold..."
links.text: "Imagine a grey coronal mist, cold vapour, marked by spores of an opportunistic microorganism -- a mould that's adapted to grow at the edge of the unrest. It's..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She closes her eyes and breathes ou..."
links.text: She closes her eyes and breathes out heavily: "... the most *disco* thing you will ever see."

links.title: Half Light: "You hear your pulse rise, the air f..."
links.text: You hear your pulse rise, the air feels caustic and cold suddenly.

links.title: You: ""What are its physical qualities?""
links.text: "What are its physical qualities?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""It's difficult to describe -- or e..."
links.text: "It's difficult to describe -- or even measure -- something whose fundamental property is the suspension of properties: physical, epistemological, linguistic..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""The further into pale you travel,..."
links.text: "The further into pale you travel, the steeper the degree of suspension. Right down to the mathematical -- *numbers* stop working. No one has yet passed the number barrier. It may be impossible."

links.title: Rhetoric: "There's a slippery article in there..."
links.text: There's a slippery article in there...

links.title: You: ""Is it *the pale* or *pale*?""
links.text: "Is it *the pale* or *pale*?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Pale when it's particular -- this..."
links.text: "Pale when it's particular -- this territory of pale -- *the* pale when it's pale in its entirety. Once you've seen it..." She tosses her head. "Language balks at the difference."

links.title: You: ""If we're surrounded by pale, how d..."
links.text: "If we're surrounded by pale, how do you get from isola to isola?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Oh, it is..." Her lungs deflate, h..."
links.text: "Oh, it is..." Her lungs deflate, her words sound like a sigh, "...*so* difficult for us."

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "A squall of birds, hardware operati..."
links.text: A squall of birds, hardware operating in the harbour. Firm, self-evident.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""It is possible to force dimensions..."
links.text: "It is possible to force dimensions on the pale -- in modern times we can even compress its latitude, bouncing radio waves from one end to the other. Shortening the path."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""But it is still hard for humans to..."
links.text: "But it is still hard for humans to navigate the pale without getting lost. Or having our minds damaged."

links.title: You: ""The pale can damage the mind?""
links.text: "The pale can damage the mind?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Extensively.""
links.text: "Extensively."

links.title: You: ""How?""
links.text: "How?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Some say the damage stems from ext..."
links.text: "Some say the damage stems from extreme sensory deprivation. Others argue that pale somehow *consists* of past information, that's degrading. That it's rarefied past, not rarefied matter."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""They call it *the blend-over of th..."
links.text: "They call it *the blend-over of the self*. The pale does not only suspend the laws of physics, but also the laws of psychology, maybe History, even... The human mind becomes over-radiated by past."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Who says and who argues?"
links.text: Who says and who argues?

links.title: You: ""Who says and who argues?""
links.text: "Who says and who argues?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""The logical positivists say -- the..."
links.text: "The logical positivists say -- the dialectical materialists argue."

links.title: You: ""What does this over-radiation feel..."
links.text: "What does this over-radiation feel like?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""It feels terrible. Absolutely terr..."
links.text: "It feels terrible. Absolutely terrible. International standards strictly limit civilian travellers to six days of pale exposure per year..."

links.title: Logic: "It's more for her -- way more."
links.text: It's more for her -- way more.

links.title: You: ""*You're* not a civilian passenger?""
links.text: "*You're* not a civilian passenger?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""No, Lieutenant Du Bois. I'm 'Entro..."
links.text: "No, Lieutenant Du Bois. I'm 'Entroponetic Business Class.' I'm cleared -- and trained -- for 22 days of pale transit annually."

links.title: Empathy: "Perhaps that explains her strange p..."
links.text: Perhaps that explains her strange pining after the Revolution? Some degraded early memories...

links.title: Logic: "Someone *else* you've met may have..."
links.text: Someone *else* you've met may have been *exposed* as well. The strange grey-haired woman in her lorry.

links.title: You: ""Do *lorry drivers* pass the pale?""
links.text: "Do *lorry drivers* pass the pale?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes. Carried in the hulls of airsh..."
links.text: "Yes. Carried in the hulls of airships," she nods. "It's a horrific job. Automation will abolish it, soon."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "You should ask the Paledriver about..."
links.text: You should ask the Paledriver about this. See what she says.

links.title: Inland Empire: "That poor woman must have stories t..."
links.text: That poor woman must have stories to tell like you wouldn't imagine...

links.title: You: ""Are *you* over-radiated?""
links.text: "Are *you* over-radiated?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Up to my gills, officer.""
links.text: "Up to my gills, officer."

links.title: Endurance: "An acidic smile on her lips. It's g..."
links.text: An acidic smile on her lips. It's getting worse every year.

links.title: You: ""*You're* not a civilian passenger?""
links.text: "*You're* not a civilian passenger?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""No, nameless detective of the Citi..."
links.text: "No, nameless detective of the Citizens Militia. I am a member of the *Entroponetic Business Class*. I'm cleared and trained for 22 days of pale transit annually."

links.title: You: "Let it go."
links.text: Let it go.

links.title: Joyce Messier: "She's looking out toward the sea, w..."
links.text: She's looking out toward the sea, what at, it's hard to say.

links.title: Inland Empire: "She's over-radiated. And then some."
links.text: She's over-radiated. And then some.

links.title: You: ""What is *entroponetic*?""
links.text: "What is *entroponetic*?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""*Entroponetics*," she corrects, "i..."
links.text: "*Entroponetics*," she corrects, "is the scientific study of the pale. Or a recent iteration of it, by way of Graad. The study of the pale reaches back 6,000 years -- the Perikarnassians called it the Western Plain."

links.title: Rhetoric: "They had not travelled the entire c..."
links.text: They had not travelled the entire circumference of the Perikarnassian super-isola. It was not merely in the West -- it was everywhere. Even then; surrounding them...

links.title: You: ""Did they... cross it? The Western..."
links.text: "Did they... cross it? The Western Plain?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""There *are* signs of pretermodern..."
links.text: "There *are* signs of pretermodern crossings. Successful navigation of the pale relies not just on technical know-how, but intensive psychological preparation. Some of these tactics have been known for thousands of years."

links.title: You: ""What has entroponetics changed the..."
links.text: "What has entroponetics changed then?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Nothing. We remain powerless befor..."
links.text: "Nothing. We remain powerless before the pale. The only real advance in pale transit is the speed with which an aerostatic craft can pierce it. Less exposure leads to less... *effects* later."

links.title: You: ""Aerostatic craft?""
links.text: "Aerostatic craft?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Hybrid airships, detective. Conven..."
links.text: "Hybrid airships, detective. Conventional rotors or jet engines no longer add velocity after the point of reference for motion is suspended -- once you've crossed from near pale to far pale..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""In essence, we throw them in and t..."
links.text: "In essence, we throw them in and they come out the other end -- if we throw them precisely."

links.title: You: ""If we do not?""
links.text: "If we do not?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Then they don't.""
links.text: "Then they don't."

links.title: Visual Calculus: "Gone -- like a skipping stone benea..."
links.text: Gone -- like a skipping stone beneath the surface.

links.title: You: ""How much pale is there compared to..."
links.text: "How much pale is there compared to the world?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""The pale outweighs reality two to..."
links.text: "The pale outweighs reality two to one -- there is more pale than there is matter. And the ratio is slipping."

links.title: You: ""Slipping how? To our detriment or...."
links.text: "Slipping how? To our detriment or..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""What do you think, detective?" She..."
links.text: "What do you think, detective?" She looks you in the eye.

links.title: You: ""It's shrinking. There is more and..."
links.text: "It's shrinking. There is more and more of the world."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Oh no, detective -- it's not. One..."
links.text: "Oh no, detective -- it's not. One of the few measurable effects of the pale is that it is expanding at an unknown rate."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""An intuitive conclusion of that de..."
links.text: "An intuitive conclusion of that development is that one day the pale will cover everything -- but this sort of talk is mostly left to extremists."

links.title: You: ""It's not extreme at all. It's goin..."
links.text: "It's not extreme at all. It's going to happen."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Most people -- and indeed most pri..."
links.text: "Most people -- and indeed most private and government sector organizations; entire civilizations and religions even -- find handy ways to ignore, or downplay that knowledge."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I suggest you do the same.""
links.text: "I suggest you do the same."

links.title: Inland Empire: "*Off we go...* you see the hanged m..."
links.text: *Off we go...* you see the hanged man's mouth open.

links.title: You: ""Off we go into the wild pale yonde..."
links.text: "Off we go into the wild pale yonder."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""One and all," she closes her eyes...."
links.text: "One and all," she closes her eyes. "They say pale is death, but for the Universe."

links.title: Inland Empire: "Why should we just leave and leave..."
links.text: Why should we just leave and leave -- and the world get left behind?

links.title: You: "Gulp."
links.text: Gulp.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""It doesn't look like you're *doing..."
links.text: "It doesn't look like you're *doing* the same. The suggestion was meant in earnest, detective. Live life."

links.title: You: ""Cover *everything*? That can't be...."
links.text: "Cover *everything*? That can't be. Where would we go..."

links.title: You: "Stay silent."
links.text: Stay silent.

links.title: You: ""It's growing. There is more and mo..."
links.text: "It's growing. There is more and more of the pale."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Precisely. One of the few measurab..."
links.text: "Precisely. One of the few measurable effects of the pale is that it is expanding at an unknown rate."

links.title: You: ""Let's return to reality, please."..."
links.text: "Let's return to reality, please." (Conclude.)

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Yes, sweet reality," she stomps he..."
links.text: "Yes, sweet reality," she stomps her foot. "But before we do, tell me detective..."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Is this the first time you're hear..."
links.text: "Is this the first time you're hearing this? Do you really not remember anything?"

links.title: You: ""Nothing. Just alcohol fumes and bl..."
links.text: "Nothing. Just alcohol fumes and blackout."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Then tell me -- what do you *think..."
links.text: "Then tell me -- what do you *think* of the pale?"

links.title: You: ""It's terrifying.""
links.text: "It's terrifying."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Hmhm..." Her eyes tense. Crow's fe..."
links.text: "Hmhm..." Her eyes tense. Crow's feet radiate from them. She observes you: your bloodshot eyes and swollen face.

links.title: Endurance: "Your ailing constitution, sweaty fo..."
links.text: Your ailing constitution, sweaty forehead, the beads there and your heavy breathing.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""You really didn't know. This does..."
links.text: "You really didn't know. This does *not* spell good for the investigation, detective. If you don't know even this, then..." She stops mid-sentence.

links.title: You: ""I'll handle it. It's under control.""
links.text: "I'll handle it. It's under control."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I hope so, I truly do. If I may su..."
links.text: "I hope so, I truly do. If I may suggest -- hold on to your colleague Kitsuragi. I ran a check on him and he is very competent. In the meanwhile..."

links.title: Empathy: "Some of that assurance is meant for..."
links.text: Some of that assurance is meant for herself, as much as it's meant for you. She must have *a lot* on the line here.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""...you have me -- I will assist yo..."
links.text: "...you have me -- I will assist you in any way I can. Even if we have to do it one basic term at a time." She gives you a slight bow.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good." The lieutenant returns. "Yo..."
links.text: "Good." The lieutenant returns. "You have not passed out from it. Perhaps I worried for nothing... Are we still on the reality low-down -- or should we do actual policework now?"

links.title: You: ""You needn't have worried.""
links.text: "You needn't have worried."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""But I did. Anyway..." He looks aro..."
links.text: "But I did. Anyway..." He looks around, a little uncomfortable now.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Dammit, you're a grown man, the lie..."
links.text: Dammit, you're a grown man, the lieutenant thinks. Shouldn't have gotten *protective* here.

links.title: You: ""That was fucking insane. Kim.""
links.text: "That was fucking insane. Kim."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, well..." he thinks. "The rest..."
links.text: "Yes, well..." he thinks. "The rest of us have dealt with it for thousands of years, so..." He looks around, a little uncomfortable now.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "You will have to deal with it too,..."
links.text: You will have to deal with it too, the lieutenant thinks. This is why I didn't want you to know.

links.title: You: ""Right. Let's get to work lieutenan..."
links.text: "Right. Let's get to work lieutenant."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Good luck, detectives." She nods y..."
links.text: "Good luck, detectives." She nods you good-bye.

links.title: You: ""Some more reality lowdown before w..."
links.text: "Some more reality lowdown before we go."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""I am happy to oblige." She awaits..."
links.text: "I am happy to oblige." She awaits your question.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good." The lieutenant returns. "Yo..."
links.text: "Good." The lieutenant returns. "You have not passed out from it. Perhaps I worried for nothing... Are we still on the reality low-down -- or should we do actual policework now?"

links.title: You: ""This investigation will be my mast..."
links.text: "This investigation will be my masterpiece. The one they remember me by. I promise."

links.title: You: ""Yes. I'm in serious trouble here.""
links.text: "Yes. I'm in serious trouble here."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Your colleague, Lieutenant Kitsura..."
links.text: "Your colleague, Lieutenant Kitsuragi, is competent. I checked up on him. And you have me -- I will try to assist you in any way I can."

links.title: Empathy: "Some of that assurance is meant for..."
links.text: Some of that assurance is meant for herself, as much as it's meant for you. She must have *a lot* on the line here.

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Even if we have to do it one basic..."
links.text: "Even if we have to do it one basic term at a time." She gives you a slight bow.

links.title: You: ""It'll be a fucking disaster, I kno..."
links.text: "It'll be a fucking disaster, I know it. All those people will die."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Steel yourself, officer," she says..."
links.text: "Steel yourself, officer," she says in a reassuring manner. "Your colleague, Lieutenant Kitsuragi -- he is competent. I checked up on him. And you also have me -- I will try to assist you in any way I can."

links.title: You: ""You were right. It's disco.""
links.text: "You were right. It's disco."

links.title: You: ""It will end all life.""
links.text: "It will end all life."

links.title: You: ""That we continue to persist at all..."
links.text: "That we continue to persist at all is a testament to our faith in one another."

links.title: You: ""Its advance can only be stopped wi..."
links.text: "Its advance can only be stopped with immediate, total, ruthless Communism."

links.title: You: ""A powerful anti-communist force. P..."
links.text: "A powerful anti-communist force. Perhaps *too* powerful... but still. They have it coming."

links.title: You: ""I'm worried. I have to say, it doe..."
links.text: "I'm worried. I have to say, it doesn't sound very *liberal* to me."

links.title: You: ""I don't know how you've all surviv..."
links.text: "I don't know how you've all survived with it -- it's a huge accomplishment."

links.title: You: ""Who am I to think *anything* of it?""
links.text: "Who am I to think *anything* of it?"

links.title: You: ""I sometimes sense vague shadows of..."
links.text: "I sometimes sense vague shadows of a past, and it's not good."

links.title: You: ""I'm getting a sense of who I am, b..."
links.text: "I'm getting a sense of who I am, but no, I didn't know this."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Beyond curious... Tell me -- what..."
links.text: "Beyond curious... Tell me -- what do you *think* of the pale?"

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""This isn't really an inquiry, is i..."
links.text: "This isn't really an inquiry, is it? You can't remember a single thing -- this is the first time you're hearing about any of this."

links.title: You: ""You're right. This is all new to m..."
links.text: "You're right. This is all new to me."

links.title: You: ""No. Nothing like that.""
links.text: "No. Nothing like that."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course, how *silly* of me. Anot..."
links.text: "Of course, how *silly* of me. Another basic term perhaps?" She stands attentively.

links.title: Drama: "There is no way in *any* reality th..."
links.text: There is no way in *any* reality that she's still buying your *shtick*. Better drop it.

links.title: You: ""I'd like to discuss something else..."
links.text: "I'd like to discuss something else, if you don't mind."

links.title: Joyce Messier: ""Of course, pardon my prying -- ano..."
links.text: "Of course, pardon my prying -- another basic term perhaps, or..." She stands attentively.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good." The lieutenant returns. "He..."
links.text: "Good." The lieutenant returns. "He has not passed out from it. Perhaps I worried for nothing... Are we still on the reality low-down -- or should we do actual policework now?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good." The lieutenant returns. "He..."
links.text: "Good." The lieutenant returns. "He has not passed out from it. Perhaps I worried for nothing... Are we still on the reality low-down -- or should we do actual policework now?"
